urls.title: Childcare in Lithuania and Belarus: How Gendered is Parenting in Eastern European Countries?
urls.description: Au≈°ra Maslauskaitƒó and Anja Steinbach write about their research in which they analysed parenting and childcare division among Lithuanian and Belarussian families.

text: One of the results of Au≈°ra Maslauskaitƒó & Anja Steinbach's analysis is that Lithuanian mothers perform more childcare tasks on their own than Belarusian mothers. Read about other findings and conclusions here: https://t.co/3KAESBRvL6 #soctwitter #poptwitter #MothersDay

text:
Looking for resources that compare/contrast/identify similarities between #CriticalRaceTheory and #antiracism. Thank you in advance! 

#SocAF @AcademicChatter

@SocScholarCR Absolutely. I love to see how stuff travels *and* citing its origins.  The #SocAF gathering at my university as far as I have seen is really committed to dissolvingwhite supremacy & abolitionist dreaming - I picked ‚Äúmilitant‚Äù more for alliteration than denotation üòÇ
@SocScholarCR Please clarify!! I want the original roots, i tweeted to document the reach & permutations of the #SocAF formation

@DumiLM @s Peace fam! Can only Black ppl use it? Nah. Is it shaped by the views of the majority Black people who created it, yes. Regardless how one identifies, if you're down to eradicate impostor syndrome (that we know is shaped by antiblackness) and build community, then you're #SocAF

Folks playing revisionist history and game of telephone with #SocAF ü§£

I have clarifying thoughts, but #Dissertation so will weigh in when I get a chance https://t.co/bvs4a8hTsd
@sgbuggs oh yes, the folks I'm used to seeing using #SocAF I still see using it, for the most part. I am wondering about the newer arrivals and what that means.
So I thought #SocAF was a Black thing... guess I missed the memo. ü•¥

Hey #AcademicTwitter #soctwitter I  need your help. I am getting mixed responses from IRB. If a project is administratively closed can I use that data and submit new article to a journal?  Data collection is completed and the data is de-identifiable. Thank you !

Super amazing ‚Å¶@UMIAMIsociology‚Å© grad student and now Dr. ‚Å¶@Masta_Seb‚Å© has a sole authored publication accepted at ‚Å¶‚Å¶@ijdrugpolicy‚Å© looking at the problematization of alcohol use in Botswana. ‚Å¶@UMCAS‚Å© #SocAF  https://t.co/VQgCTZza3Y

urls.title: the Sociologist's Dojo's Podcast: Episode 8: Mulholland Drive w/ Dr. Courtenay Stallings
urls.description: On This Month's episode of The Sociologist's Dojo Podcast we are diving into the work of David Lynch, and his 2001 Neo Noir Mulholland Drive with guest Dr. Courtenay Stallings of Pepperdine University and author of the book Together, we are not only going to piece together the winding Lynchian narrative of the film, but we also interrogate a lot of Lynch's other work.¬† At the end of the episode will have you saying: "This is the girl."¬† Production Notes: Basics: Dr. Stallings¬† (1:07-35:22) Marrying Academic work with Pop Culture Interests Gushing over¬†Laura's Ghost¬† Stumping for Qualitative Research¬† Research based questions (11:21-18:38) Basics: Mulholland Drive (35:57-48:33) Trivia¬† Plot Synopsis¬† Historical Context: (48:47-102:22) How 9/11 Effected the Box Office Sales¬† The Cultural Lag of "Lynchian" Appreciation¬† The critical praise and accessibility of Mulholland Drive¬† Lynch's Career Timeline¬† Social Analysis: (1:02:36-1:19:24) Analysis of Sexual Violence in Lynch's work Queer Re

text:
New Episode Alert!

This Month I talk to @CourtenayCal about Mulholland Drive, The Work of David Lynch, and her fantastic new book "Laura's Ghost: Women Talk about Twin Peaks" 
#SocAF #Sociology #MovieReviews #DavidLych #TwinPeaks #MulhollandDrive

Enjoy!

https://t.co/sxcFtAZv75

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Twin Peaks
entity.description: In the 1990s, residents of quaint northwestern town Twin Peaks were stunned by the murder of homecoming queen Laura Palmer. Now 25 years later, Special Agent Dale Cooper, who investigated the student's death, heads out on an odyssey that returns him to the Washington town. Creator David Lynch directs all 18 episodes of this long-awaited follow-up to the cult classic series that originally aired from 1990-91 and spawned the 1992 prequel film "Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me."

entity.name: Twin Peaks: The Return
entity.description: Twenty-five years after the murder of a teenager in Twin Peaks, special agent Dale Cooper returns to the quiet town. Includes details of how the residents have managed to cope with the tragedy.

@Lex_Palomino @SocScholarCR You are #SocAF! You got this!

Built community today through my students doing the work of community education in their virtual teach-in for their final project in my Abolition course. This group, and all the students in this course, are so dope! #SocAF https://t.co/hDBEp2kwlK https://t.co/KqBR5lln4g

#mpirawamiguu https://t.co/yLQ7l0Bv8l

I got another #SocAF!

My little sister @aahrelee is graduating from SMC and transferring to the Sociology Department @CSULB üéâüéâüéâüéâ

Hella excited for her ‚ú® just as hyped about the possibility of her learning with/from @osuna213 and @DrClaudia_Lopez üî•

Inspired by another #twitterscholar, I‚Äôve started sending notes of gratitude to fellow scholars, two and counting. Also following the advice of my friend Helene who says ‚ÄòAutomate life sustaining things‚Äô, I‚Äôm going to set a weekly gratitude calendar reminder. #SocAF
This weeks #socaf is in celebration of me making it end of another semester unapologetically https://t.co/a3jGn6ypUO

Presented work from my diss for the first time Mon. & was reminded how critical it is to surround yourself with folks who show up & out for you! Grateful for #CMB squad @ErinJMcCauley @mendoza_yosi @EmilyA_Parker @BlancaArRamirez 
+ @its_Serrano on PST ready to throw hands #SocAF

It's been soooo freaking tough getting to this point, but I defend my dissertation proposal tomorrow! I'm "behind schedule" according to my institution, but I'M STILL PERSISTING. S/o to my mentors who keep me going! #socAF

Officially done with PhD Year 1. This year, I dealt with multiple aggressions from a white female prof and was told my work wasn‚Äôt good enough. I cried a lot and I almost quit. 

But‚Ä¶I‚Äôm still here and I feel my ancestors with me today. I am so full of gratitude! #SocAF

I reached out to my UG advisor to arrange lunch. I plan to thank her for showing me how to run my first crosstab many moons ago. I also had a conversation today with @hannahschaef about motherhood and "professionalism" in academia. I love having moms in my corner. #SocAF https://t.co/XGfVjs9m7W

text: @1solbro My most frequently used meme! Lol but also your #socaf is fire! *chefs kiss https://t.co/xuAuFtHP3K

This was a rough semester but what are some things that were great about it? I was just thinking about how awesome it is that five of my undergrads will individually be published authors. Working with them this semester was a joy. #AcademicChatter #AcademicTwitter #SOCAF
I am actually working on my dissertation today and feeling good about it so that is my #SocAF for the day. ü§ó
My #SocAf today: I posted the last grades I will post for the next 15 months. https://t.co/LwKMrZX64e
My #SOCAF this week is I have made the leftover #2 Word file of my dissertation proposal. Don't know why but it feels like hitting a milestone. ü§î
Had a much needed check in with my grad school bestie today and that's my #SocAF this week.
My #socaf today is that I got to ‚Äúwalk‚Äù a year later from the only PhD in sociology at an HBCU from @HowardU https://t.co/7N5DJaZ7YN

My #SocAF is dedicated to @smosaidso and @_thegabemiller. They love me enough to make sure I don't quit on myself but also believe in me so much all of the time - like really all of the time. I don't know why but I am extremely lucky to have friends/mentors like them. https://t.co/OO0FAgtV80
My #SocAF tweet üíÅüèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è https://t.co/Aj0w7jA9k4
@ASAnews One of my classes really gelled as community this year; yesterday to say goodbye we went outside in the drizzle and sat by the pink azalea and just visited like people together #SocAF

Just finished my second year of coursework (class wise). My courses, all together, this semester were truly a gift and developed into true spaces of intellectual belonging. 

Now, time to write these finals and be DONE. #SocAF

I turned in a draft of my final empirical dissertation chapter yesterday (!!), & in response to me saying how dead I feel, my friends reminded me that if I were to actually perish, as of 5:43pm yesterday, my dissertation is done enough to receive a posthumous PhD. ü•Çü§£ #SocAf
My #socAF this week is being 19 days away from my dissertation defense & being a #phd üòÄ

Last class of first year of my PhD program ‚úîÔ∏è
One more paper to finish..am I a rising second yr student yet? üßê #socaf

a student calling me üêê is my #SocAF! 

but really it is shameful that I am her first WoC professor. We gotta do better. https://t.co/mIR3vw6mrk

#SocAF means so much! Here's why, @KoreyTillman_

https://t.co/NfR66nhsJv
I received üí∞ and  ‚òéÔ∏è affirmations from friends to push me over this diss finish line. My community keeps holding me up (and dragging me over) #SocAF

I've been connecting with more people #onhere this week in order to build community. Gained some fabulous ideas for a new course prep, gonna get to try some homemade hot sauce, it's been a win #SocAF https://t.co/YusVpLCQP4
My #SocAF for  this week: (1) these üî•üî•üî• pancakes i am making right now and (2) my espresso machine arrived yesterday üòé
My #SocAF this week is that I've actively engaged with my meditation üßòüèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èpractice each morning. I think I'm ready to move up in time, 10 minutes now feels like 5, ready for 15üòÄ

text: My #SocAF this week is that I chose me. I put in my notice to my full time job & my last day in the public sector is this Friday. I am fully committing to my studies and finishing my doctorate. I chose peace, time, energy and focus on my dream over money. Now and forever.

text: Detection and spillovers in @audit_studies can significantly bias discrimination estimates towards zero, especially for smaller demographic groups like #LGBTQ. #EconTwitter #SocTwitter, from Catherine Balfe, @ProfPButton, Mary Penn, and David Schwegman https://t.co/INjaXKcTVq https://t.co/fwtRVj11s9

text: Got a (fair!) article reject this wk. BUT! *5* helpful peer reviews, constructive letter from editor, and turnaround less than 2 mo. I know not everyone can work at full capacity these days, but props & appreciation to those who are out there crushin‚Äô it! #socaf #AcademicChatter
